title: Does writing help with anxiety? - Quora

response.answer_text: Short answer: yes. Sometimes I just have so much going on in my head and I need to get it out. If I can’t talk to someone about it, I write. Most of the time it’s a kind of journal entry where I write down the story of whatever I’m anxious about. Sometimes I write letters to people without ever planning to send them. If I’m just anxious and don’t know why, then writing helps me figure out what’s wrong. I just pull out a notebook or the diary app on my phone and let the words flow. Writing things that aren’t related to my anxiety helps as well. I write short stories, illustrate comics, or go on Quora to answer other people’s questions. Anything to get my mind focused on something else. Something productive. So yes, writing helps with anxiety. It’s a creative outlet and a safe way to process your emotions at your own pace.
